clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Improve the Treatment of Patients With Heart Failure by General Practitioners

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether it is possible to improve the care of general practitioners for patients with heart failure. The investigators try to reach that goal by training the GP's for 90 minutes in uptitrating the recommended medication according the guidelines. After 6 month the investigators ask the patients to fill out a questionary. The investigators ask them about their quality of live.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Caregiver), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: proportion recommended medication for patients with heart failure
primary_outcome.description: the proportion patient who got at the end of the study the tree medicaments which should be prescribed to a patient with heart failure.

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of quality of live six months after uptitration of the recommended medication.

arm_group.description: General practitioners are trained to diagnose and treat heart failure according the recommendations of the NHG-standard.
General practitioners giving care as usual to their heart failure patients.

intervention.intervention_name: GP's treating HF according the dutch guidelines

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Do have a general practitioners diagnosis heart failure mentioned twice in the electronical medical file.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incapacitated patients with a life expectancy of less than 2 months
- Seniles
- Patients who do not speak the Dutch language

clinical_study.keyword: Heart failure, general practitioner, medical therapy, quality of live
